properties.name: 4th Grade
properties.description: Posted by MoyockokieJet, OKWhen I was in 4th grade, 1978, our house was torched (arson) by the owner, and we ended up moving to Jet, OK, to finish out the school year. We moved back to Helena, after that. Close to Jet are the famous Salt Plains, left over from pre-historic days. Tourists and locals go out there to dig up the unique salt crystals, always hoping to get the elusive "rose" crystals.

properties.name: AZ A School
properties.description: Posted by Moyockokie 740 FLETCHER ROAD MERIDIAN MS 39309-5040I went to AZ "A" School at NTTC Meridian, MS, it was a 6-week school, to teach us the basics about the Aviation Maintenance Administrationman rate. I did very well in the class, achieving a top score, (top of the boot camps, not top of the class; a "fleet returnee" female Marine got a higher score). That normally would have earned me the right to choose orders to my first command in the fleet, but it didn\'t work that way with my class. The Leading Chief Petty Officer simply told us where we were going, with no choices. I ended up getting orders to the one and only, the one of a kind, CV-67, USS John F. Kennedy, stationed in Norfolk, VA.

properties.name: Autry Technical Center
properties.description: Posted by Moyockokie1201 west willow, enid ok 73703After high school, from 1987-1988, I attended Autry Vo-Tech, later renamed. I went morning and afternoon, completing a 2-year course in one year, of Culinary Arts. It was fun, and I couldn\'t find a job anyway, so it was something to fill my time till I could find work. I did end up working for a while at the "Next Door" restaurant, and then the Maxwell Pancake House. I had started out the year living with relatives and ended the school year living on my own at the age of 18. I graduated with a grade of 4.0, sharing the top score with a good friend, an old oil well worker looking to get training in a new vocation. It was a good time, and I grew up a lot, but living alone was very boring.

properties.name: College
properties.description: Posted by Moyockokie 1801 East 4th - Okmulgee, OK 74447I got an Associate\'s Degree in Culinary Arts etc. here, and met and married my wife of 17 years!

properties.name: Enlisting in the Navy
properties.description: Posted by Moyockokie1222 Spruce Street St. Louis, MO 63103-2816In February 1991, I enlisted in the Navy, as an Undesignated Fireman (WTFO?), and was in boot camp in less than a week! My hotel I stayed in while going through the Military Entrance Processing Station (MEPS), was right across the street from the Arch.

properties.name: GSE A School
properties.description: Posted by Moyockokie 2601A Paul Jones St Great Lakes IL 60088-5000 I went to my first "A" school in Great Lakes, IL. I was sent there after Boot Camp and Apprenticeship Training, in Orlando, FL. After working in the Galley, "mess cranking", and cleaning in the school house (1st LT), I was told (along with 7 or 8 others) that I was too hard-of-hearing to be in an engineering rating, and had to re-classify. I was given 3 options; getting a new school and rating in a less noisy environment, going back out to the fleet as an undesignated Fireman, or going home and getting out of the Navy. Getting out was not an option (I needed the money), and I had earned my school, so I re-classified. I got the Aviation Maintenance Administrationman (AZ) school, which is in Meridian, MS.

properties.name: Home
properties.description: Posted by Moyockokiehelena, okThis is where I did most of my growing up, Helena OK, from 1st grade to graduation from Helena-Goltry High School in 1987, which has since been re-named Timberlake High School.

properties.name: Looking for work
properties.description: Posted by MoyockokieDoniphan, mo 63935I lived in Doniphan, MO for close to a year, in which I had three jobs; working for the city, working in a Shoney\'s Restaraunt in Poplar Bluff, and working on the towboats on the Mississippi and Ohio Rivers.

properties.name: Navy Boot Camp Orlando
properties.description: Posted by Moyockokieorlando flI went to boot camp in Orlando Fl; Company C083. I was in the Choir, being a poor marcher. After the first two weeks I really enjoyed Boot Camp. After that, I went to Fireman Apprenticeship Training, on the other side of the base, where I learned exactly what an Undesignated Fireman was expected to do in the Navy....nothing I wanted to do! I worked hard, and got top of the class, earning the "A" School of my choice. I chose GSE School, located in Great Lakes IL. It was a fairly new rating; Gas Turbine Electrician\'s Mate with excellent advancement opportunities and a 0,000 re-enlistment bonus available.

properties.name: Sophomore Year
properties.description: Posted by Moyockokie611 West Wabash Avenue, Enid, OK 73701 I went to school here for a few months in my Sophomore year, wrecking my credits for graduation when I moved back home to Helena.
